alert.note: Alert for Schleicher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 11:04AM CDT until May 27 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Schleicher. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated light showers over the eastern half of Schleicher county. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.10 inches are expected the the eastern half of Schleicher county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eldorado, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1828 And Ranch Road 915, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084, Adams, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1828 and Us-190 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
